content.description: Start with some chossy ledge climbing, then pull yourself over the bulge to the anchors
content.location: To the left of Choss City after the short mossy section of wall

content.description: Grab my terry flaps Squeeze my holdy folds Hold my chossy folds Grab my mossy holds Grab my dirty flap holds Grab my terryfolds Hold my moldy folds Break my chossy holds
content.location: To the right of the choss tower

content.description: The sister climb to "Despair", this route starts on the left side of the roof.  Find good pockets under the roof, then reach out to the crimps on the face.  Climb up the face to the good jugs then top out.  This route is bound to become more difficult as the lower, chossy crimps break.  I "hope" that doesn't happen anytime soon!

From the ledge, reeeeaaaach out under the roof to the giant huecos.  Traverse right through the huecos then top out over the bulge using good jugs.  A harder variation exists by going straight up from the second bolt on crimps
content.protection: One bolt in the roof, glue ins

content.description: Dealer's choice to gain the ledge.  Then up the ridge of the hueco on the right side of the roof.  Traverse left on the low crimps on the face, then up to a single pocket before the top out
Jump start from the boulder or otherwise choss climb your way onto the ledge.  Uses a critical hueco on the bulge.
content.protection: 2 bolts, one bolt at the top with a quick link
content.location: A few feet to the right of "Be the Choss"

content.description: Rock quality is typical for the other climbs in the area. Some people adapt to the choss.  Do you trust your holds?  Can you tell what will break and what will stay?2 bolts, 1 glue in and 2 glue in anchors
content.protection: 3 bolts and lower off perma draws

content.description: Straight up the middle of the Choss Tower.  A deep pocket just above the bulge, then a juggy hold before a 3 to 4 finger pocket.
content.protection: 2 bolts and lower off perma draws

content.description: To the right of Choss City, marked by chossy flakes and a good juggy pocket.
content.location: Behind Big and Tall boulder on The Choss Tower

content.description: The cliffs behind Chuck Norris boulder and Big and Tall boulder. The climbing here is mostly short, hard, chossy, dirty, mossy, and/ or lichen covered. The risk of injury from falling rocks is very high- best not to stand under the climber!
